snippet: The high-stakes strike by 26,000 public school teachers in Chicago is only the latest episode in which the nation’s teachers’ unions have been thrown on the defensive.
abstract: High-stakes strike by 26,000 school teachers in Chicago is only the latest episode in which the nation's teachers' unions have been thrown on the defensive in the face of demands for far-reaching changes; strike could set the table for a major setback for teachers’ unions nationwide and a potential rethinking of their enthusiasm for Democrats in this year’s elections.
lead_paragraph: The high-stakes strike by 26,000 public school teachers in Chicago is only the latest episode in which the nation’s teachers’ unions have been thrown on the defensive.

headline.seo: In Chicago Teachers’ Strike, Signs of Unions Under Siege
headline.main: In Standoff, Latest Sign of Unions Under Siege
headline.print_headline: In Standoff, Latest Sign of Unions Under Siege
